body:
# Jennifer SQLite3 adapter [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/imdrasil/jennifer_sqlite3_adapter.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/imdrasil/jennifer_sqlite3_adapter) [![Latest Release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/imdrasil/jennifer_sqlite3_adapter.svg)](https://github.com/imdrasil/jennifer_sqlite3_adapter/releases) [![Docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-available-brightgreen.svg)](https://imdrasil.github.io/jennifer_sqlite3_adapter/versions)

SQLite3 adapter for [Jennifer](https://github.com/imdrasil/jennifer.cr).

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:
```yaml
dependencies:
  jennifer_sqlite3_adapter:
    github: imdrasil/jennifer_sqlite3_adapter
```
2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

This shard requires Jennifer `~> 0.7.0`. It is tested with SQLite 3.22.0 version.

```crystal
require "jennifer"
require "jennifer_sqlite3_adapter"

Jennifer::Config.configure do |conf|
  conf.adapter = "sqlite3"
  conf.host = "."
  conf.db = "test.db"
end
```

`user` and `password` configuration is not required as database is SQLite doesn't provide db-user authentication and they are ignored. `host` options is used to specify path to db-file, `db` - file name.

As

### Supported data types

| Method | SQLite3 | Crystal type |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `#bool` | `INTEGER` | `Bool` |
| `#integer` | `INTEGER` | `Int32` |
| `#bigint` | `INTEGER` | `Int32` |
| `#short` | `INTEGER` | `Int32` |
| `#tinyint` | `INTEGER` | `Int32` |
| `#float`| `REAL` | `Float64` |
| `#double` | `REAL` | `Float64` |
| `#real` | `REAL` | `Float64` |
| `#text` | `TEXT` | `String` |
| `#string` | `TEXT` | `String` |
| `#varchar` | `TEXT` | `String` |
| `#time` | `TEXT` | `Time` |
| `#timestamp` | `TEXT` | `Time` |

### Altering table

SQLite has no mechanism to alter existing table (except renaming it). Therefore operations, listed below, do multiple steps to achieve altering table: coping table schema to new temp table, coping data to new table, extending new table with required options, dropping old table and renaming temp table to original name:

- dropping column
- changing column
- adding foreign key
- dropping foreign key

It is necessary to notice that all those operations keep all data and indexes.

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/imdrasil/jennifer_sqlite3_adapter/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Roman Kalnytskyi](https://github.com/imdrasil) - creator and maintainer

def.name: command_interface
def.body: @@command_interface || (@@command_interface = CommandInterface.new(Config.instance))

def.name: column_exists?
def.body:
(MetaTable.table(table)).first.try do |__arg2|
  __arg2.columns.any? do |__arg3|
    __arg3.name == name.to_s
  end
end || false

def.name: foreign_key_exists?
def.body:
(MetaTable.table(from_table)).first.try do |__arg4|
  __arg4.foreign_keys.any? do |__arg5|
    __arg5.to_table == to_table.to_s
  end
end || false

def.name: foreign_key_exists?
def.body: raise(ArgumentError.new("Use table names instead"))

def.name: index_exists?
def.body:
(MetaTable.table(table)).first.try do |__arg0|
  __arg0.indexes.any? do |__arg1|
    __arg1.name == name.to_s
  end
end || false

def.name: schema_processor
def.body: @schema_processor || (@schema_processor = SchemaProcessor.new(self))

def.name: sql_generator
def.body: SQLGenerator

def.name: table_column_count
def.body:
if table_exists?(table)
  (MetaTable.table(table)).first!.columns.size
else
  -1
end

def.name: table_exists?
def.body: (MetaTable.table(table)).exists?

def.name: translate_type
def.body: translate_type(name.to_s)

def.name: translate_type
def.body:
begin
  TYPE_TRANSLATIONS[name]
rescue e : KeyError
  raise(BaseException.new("Unknown data alias #{name}"))
end

def.name: view_exists?
def.body: (MetaTable.view(table)).exists?

def.name: with_table_lock
def.body:
transaction do |t|
  Config.logger.debug("SQLite3 doesn't support manual locking table from prepared statement. Instead of this only transaction was started.")
  yield t
end

def.name: create_database
def.body:
options = [db_path, ""] of Command::Option
command = Command.new(executable: "sqlite3", options: options)
execute(command)

def.name: drop_database
def.body:
options = [db_path] of Command::Option
command = Command.new(executable: "rm", options: options)
execute(command)

def.name: generate_schema
def.body:
options = [db_path, ".schema"] of Command::Option
command = Command.new(executable: "sqlite3", options: options, out_stream: " | grep -v sqlite_sequence > #{config.structure_path}")
execute(command)

def.name: load_schema
def.body:
options = [db_path] of Command::Option
command = Command.new(executable: "sqlite3", options: options, in_stream: "cat #{config.structure_path} |")
execute(command)

def.name: add_foreign_key
def.body:
table = from_table
ignore_foreign_keys do
  temp_table_name = "#{table}_temp"
  t = find_table(table)
  fk = ForeignKey.new(to_table.to_s, column.to_s, primary_key.to_s)
  create_table(temp_table_name, t.columns, t.foreign_keys + [fk])
  copy_data(temp_table_name, table, t.columns.map(&.name))
  drop_table(table)
  rename_table(temp_table_name, table)
  create_indexes(t)
end

def.name: change_column
def.body:
ignore_foreign_keys do
  temp_table_name = "#{table}_temp"
  t = find_table(table)
  fields = t.columns.map(&.name)
  new_fields = fields.clone
  new_fields[fields.index(&.==(old_name.to_s)).as(Int32)] = new_name.to_s
  create_table(temp_table_name, t.columns.reject do |__arg4|
    __arg4.name == old_name.to_s
  end, t.foreign_keys)
  add_column(temp_table_name, new_name, opts)
  copy_data(temp_table_name, table, new_fields, fields)
  drop_table(table)
  rename_table(temp_table_name, table)
  create_indexes(t)
end

def.name: drop_column
def.body:
ignore_foreign_keys do
  temp_table_name = "#{table}_temp"
  t = find_table(table)
  columns = t.columns.reject do |__arg0|
    __arg0.name == name.to_s
  end
  create_table(temp_table_name, columns, t.foreign_keys)
  copy_data(temp_table_name, table, columns.map(&.name))
  drop_table(table)
  rename_table(temp_table_name, table)
  create_indexes(t)
end

def.name: drop_foreign_key
def.body:
to_table = to_table_from_fk_name(from_table.to_s, name)
table = from_table
ignore_foreign_keys do
  temp_table_name = "#{table}_temp"
  t = find_table(table)
  create_table(temp_table_name, t.columns, t.foreign_keys.reject do |__arg6|
    __arg6.to_table == to_table
  end)
  copy_data(temp_table_name, table, t.columns.map(&.name))
  drop_table(table)
  rename_table(temp_table_name, table)
  create_indexes(t)
end

def.name: rename_table
def.body: adapter.exec("ALTER TABLE #{old_name.to_s} RENAME TO #{new_name.to_s}")

def.name: insert
def.body:
opts = obj.arguments_to_insert
String.build do |s|
  (s << "INSERT INTO ") << obj.class.table_name
  if !opts[:fields].empty?
    s << "("
    opts[:fields].join(", ", s)
    ((s << ") VALUES (") << (escape_string(opts[:fields].size))) << ") "
  else
    s << " DEFAULT VALUES"
  end
end

class_methods.name: json_path
class_methods.doc: SQLite doesn't support JSON at all.

def.name: json_path
def.body: raise(BaseException.new("JSON selector isn't supported"))

def.name: lock_clause
def.body:
if query._lock.nil?
  return
end
raise(BaseException.new("LOCK command isn't supported"))

def.name: order_expression
def.body:
if expression.null_position.none?
  super(expression)
else
  String.build do |io|
    (((((io << "CASE WHEN ") << ((expression.criteria.is(nil)).as_sql(self))) << " THEN 0 ELSE 1 ") << (expression.null_position.last? ? "DESC" : "ASC")) << " END, ") << (super(expression))
  end
end

def.name: truncate
def.body: raise(BaseException.new("TRUNCATE command isn't supported"))

class_methods.name: update
class_methods.doc: Generates update request depending on given query and hash options.
class_methods.summary: Generates update request depending on given query and hash options.

def.name: update
def.body:
esc = escape_string(1)
String.build do |s|
  (s << "UPDATE ") << query.table
  s << " SET "
  options.join(", ", s) do |__arg0|
    k = __arg0[0]
    ((s << k) << " = ") << esc
  end
  s << " "
  where_clause(s, query.tree)
end
